docs.snippet: While much has been written about the Underground Railroad, there has been little visual documentation. But a new photo book depicts the 1,400 mile long trek through forests, swamps, safe houses, and freedom in the north.

headline.main: From Slavery to Freedom: Revealing the Underground Railroad

docs.abstract: While much has been written about the Underground Railroad, there has been little visual documentation. But a new photo book depicts the 1,400 mile long trek through forests, swamps, safe houses, and freedom in the north.

docs.snippet: Many responding to a Times article about a call center voiced sympathy for the victims of fraud, and anger at the criminals and a system that does little to protect the vulnerable.

headline.print_headline: How to Handle India’s Phone Swindlers? Readers Share Stories
headline.main: ‘I Thought I Was Impervious to Scams’: Readers Denounce India’s Phone Swindlers

docs.snippet: For decades, dominance in the technology industry was based on software or hardware. Now it is increasingly based on who owns the best data.

headline.print_headline: Data Could Be the Next Tech Hot Button

docs.snippet: A judge in Spain will hear criminal proceedings against nine Syrian officials in a torture case, in which the victim’s sister is a Spanish citizen.

docs.snippet: A video circulated online shows a white teenager tied up and beaten as a group of black young adults shouted antiwhite messages and insulted Donald J. Trump.

headline.print_headline: Chicago Police Question 4 After Video Shows Man Being Beaten in Apparent Racial Attack
headline.main: 4 Questioned After Video Shows Racially Charged Beating in Chicago

docs.snippet: You could follow a recipe, sure, or you could make leftovers quesadillas out of whatever you have in the fridge.
When a black man ended up face down on the ground after a New Year’s celebration, residents of a predominantly white village were outraged.

headline.main: A Small Ohio Town Clamors to Curb Aggressive Policing

docs.snippet: A program in Northampton in which officers would greet elementary school students ended after a month in response to some children feeling uncomfortable.

headline.print_headline: Police Shut Down a Youth Outreach Effort, Angering the Grown-Ups
headline.main: End to Police ‘High Five Fridays’ at Schools Roils a Massachusetts Town

docs.snippet: Homeowners around the country have opened up their living rooms for political causes and to help build community.
